abstract: While continuing to avoid predictions of a recession, Ben S. Bernanke told a Senate panel on Thursday that the economic outlook had worsened.
snippet: While continuing to avoid predictions of a recession, Ben S. Bernanke told a Senate panel on Thursday that the economic outlook had worsened.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Ben S. Bernanke, the chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said on Thursday that the economic outlook had worsened, and he left room for the central bank to reduce interest rates yet again.

headline.main: Fed Chief Leaves Room for More Rate Cuts

abstract: Hewlett-Packard has agreed to a financial settlement with The New York Times and three Business Week magazine journalists in connection with the company’s spying scandal.
snippet: Hewlett-Packard has agreed to a financial settlement with The New York Times and three Business Week magazine journalists in connection with the company’s spying scandal.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Hewlett-Packard has agreed to a financial settlement with The New York Times and three BusinessWeek magazine journalists in connection with the company’s spying scandal that stemmed from surreptitiously obtaining private phone records.

headline.print_headline: H.P. Agrees to Settle Journalist Spy Case

abstract: Howard Silverblatt of Standard & Poor’s reports that St. Valentine’s Day tends to be a poor day in the stock market, with the S.&P. 500 rising only 39 percent of the time, and fallling 57 percent of the time.
lead_paragraph: Howard Silverblatt of Standard & Poor’s reports that St. Valentine’s Day tends to be a poor day in the stock market, with the S.&P. 500 rising only 39 percent of the time, and fallling 57 percent of the time.
